content.question_text: Directions : Each of the following sentences in this section has a blank space and four words or group of words are given after the sentence. Select the most appropriate word or group of words for the blank space and indicate your response on the Answer Sheet accordingly.The population of Mumbai and Delhi is greater than ______________ city in India.
He is one of the ________________ in the country.
He has the ______________ touch of a maestro.
He feels that he has been ____________.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : taken for granted

content.question_text: Had he told me the news beforehand, I ______________ careful and saved my money.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : would have been

content.question_text: Life has been thrown ____________ due to the weather conditions in the city.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : out of gear

content.question_text: The campaign is in ____________ .
What you propose is _____________ .

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : out of the question

content.question_text: If a Time Machine _____________ you anywhere for one day, where would you go ?
He _____________ waiting for you since morning.
‘Perspicacity’ and ‘Perspicuity’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Perspicacity means ability to discern and Perspicuity means lucidity of expression

content.question_text: ‘Complaisant’ and ‘Complacent’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Complaisant means eager to please and Complacent means overconfident

content.question_text: ‘Compliment’ and ‘Complement’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Compliment means to praise and Complement means to go well with

content.question_text: ‘Deify’ and ‘Defy’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : To deify means to confer upon one the status of God and to defy means to oppose

content.question_text: ‘Evoke’ and ‘Invoke’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Evoke means to elicit a response and Invoke means to call upon through an appeal

content.question_text: ‘Sympathy’ and ‘Empathy’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Sympathy means expressing another’s feelings and Empathy means sharing another’s feelings

content.question_text: ‘Accept’ and ‘Except’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Accept means to agree and Except means to exclude

content.question_text: ‘Reward’ and ‘Award’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Reward is compensation for effort and Award is prize for recognition

content.question_text: ‘Emigrate’ and ‘Immigrate’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Emigrate means to leave for another country and Immigrate means to arrive at another country

content.question_text: 'Immolate’ and ‘Emulate’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Immolate means to sacrifice and Emulate means to follow someone out of admiration

System performance was demonstrated _____________ the Drop Zone from an altitude of 5000 m.
Ranjit has been elected as _____________ leader of the group in the house.
Entry ____________ the building was restricted due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Education is a manifestation of _______________ perfection already in man.
______________ university is a place for thinking and learning.
Amid _____________ few incidents of violence, the voting went on well.
Scholars are often caught on the horns of ____________ dilemma.
You need to make others feel that you are second _____________ none.
How many students have come _____________ you for the programme ?
Rahul must have received the dues ___________ now.
It is not that I do not take a decision,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : I decide not to take a decision.

content.question_text: If I were in your position,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : I would not accept this compensation.

content.question_text: If I were in your position,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : should I not accept the compensation.

content.question_text: There are many career options,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : you can choose any of them.

content.question_text: If you had prepared well,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : you would have fared well.

content.question_text: Where there is a will,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : there is a way.

content.question_text: “It is getting dark,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : can I turn on the lights ?”

content.question_text: Once I met a traveller

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : who said he had been to an ancient place.

content.question_text: Man is the greatest truth of all,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : there is nothing beyond him.

content.question_text: If your life is circumscribed by habits alone,

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : you are merely an imitative machine.

content.question_text: in the filaments of (P) / rubidium is used (Q) / which convert light energy into electrical energy (R) / photoelectric cells (S)
he urged so many to get involved (P) / who has left his mark (Q) / this is the final word of an educational philosopher (R) / on a world in which (S)
or the opposite (P) / where you say one thing (Q) / irony is a figure of speech (R) / while you mean another (S)
across the world (P) / in the Middle East has changed (Q) / the discovery of petroleum (R) / the lifestyle of the people (S)
as a source of energy (P) / the camel uses fat (Q) / in the desert (R) / during its long journey (S)
must support the main part (P) / the-beginning and the concluding lines (Q) / described in the story (R) / or the events (S)
is being systematically damaged (P) / our beautiful riverine ecosystem (Q) / by industrial pollution (R) / channelled into rivers (S)
the film industry due to (P) / nearness to the viewers (Q) / its ready availability and (R) / the television screen is challenging (S)
they built an Artificial Intelligence system (P) / researchers say that (Q) / makes ethical judgments (R) / that like humans (S)
he is a fool, it is that (P) / others think intelligently (Q) / it is not that (R) / he does not think (S)
China’s objective of signing a security pact with Solomon Islands is

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : to contribute in ensuring security in the Pacific.

content.question_text: The Pact symbolises China’s doctrine of

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : deployment of security forces wherever needed.

content.question_text: Which one of the following is implied by ‘Beijing would not seek to become a global hegemon’?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Beijing is not aspiring to have control over the world.

content.question_text: What does ‘square with that idea’ imply in the passage ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Agreeing with the multiple views

content.question_text: What does ‘strategic foothold’ imply in the passage ?
What is ‘international carbon trading system’ here ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The exchange of carbon credits between nations

content.question_text: What is the third issue being mentioned in the context of ‘share of the revenue’ ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Developed countries would take the revenue from bilateral trading agreements.

content.question_text: ... forests to act as a carbon sink’ means

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Forests reduce carbon emission.

content.question_text: What is the concern about the integrity of the accounting system ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Developed countries and companies would be adhering to the credit system.

content.question_text: Which of the following words is nearer to the meaning of the word ‘protocol’ in the text ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : formal ways of doing something

content.question_text: What are the volatile components of inflation ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Components such as food and fuel

content.question_text: What are the volatile components of inflation ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : All subgroups in the index

content.question_text: In what context are the words’ ‘pass through’ used in the passage ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : That services sector will increase prices as demand picks up

content.question_text: Explain the meaning of the word ‘quotidian’ as used in the passage.
Choose the most appropriate option that describes the meaning of the term ‘unanchoring’ as used in the passage.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The disjoint between inflation and its expectations

content.question_text: He is considered the harbinger.
The vista of the villages is beautiful.
Her act was considered as most lamentable.
The leader's endurance paid and he won the elections.
We are planning a jaunt for a while during the winter.
It would be nice to have ( a) / a good evening stroll ( b) / after five hours of office. ( c) / No error ( d)
Arun likes ( a) / Geography more than ( b) / he likes History. ( c) / No error ( d)
While the solar energy has grabbed the spotlight, ( a) / wind power too has been made steady progress ( b) / across the world and in India. ( c) / No error ( d)
Pride brings a (a ) / great dealing of vanity, (b ) / an egotistic inflation. (c ) / No error (d )
Persuasion happens only ( a) / when someone takes a stand ( b) / from which he has unwilling to move. ( c) / No error ( d)
The food consumed ( a) / in the body is converted on ( b) / into glucose. ( c) / No error ( d)
This testing method requires ( a) / one to fast overnight after which ( b) / the fasting blood sugar level is measured. ( c) / No error ( d)
Multiple research studies ( a) / have laid emphasis on the importance ( b) / of walking to improved glucose control. ( c) / No error ( d)
This also allows ( a) / individual writers ( b) / to play his strengths. ( c) / No error ( d)
As a screen writer, ( a) / there are, broadly speaking, ( b) / two kind of jobs in the film world. ( c) / No error ( d)
He headed. the Indian freedom struggle which paved the way for non-violent struggle for other countries in the 20th century.
Where there is peace for some time, there will be prosperity.
Alas ! We have been defeated.
A zero is a zero always.
May you be blessed with all good things of life.
The lake is one of the more beautiful ones in the country.
Honesty is the best policy.
There is many a slip between the cup and the lip.
Ravi and Megha reached first, but Guha and Saavi finished third.
He is the most sought after teacher in the school.

S1: A licensee who wants to surrender his license shall apply in Form X to the licensing officer.P: This shall not entitle the licensee to any compensation by way of license fee in any form.Q: If the licensing officer is satisfied, he may accept the surrender.R: The license shall be deemed to have been terminated from the date of such acceptance.S: The application shall be accompanied by a declaration of stock in Form V.S6: The licensee who has surrendered his license shall be allowed to sell the antiquities declared to another licensee or a recognized museum in India.

S1 : Haryana has achieved the 2nd rank among States in Logistics Ease Across Different States (LEADS) - 2021 report.P: This makes Haryana a top performer in the northern cluster of land-locked States.Q: The State has taken a leap from the 6th overall position in the previous evaluation (2019).R: The improvement in ranking reflects focused initiatives by the State in improving the infrastructure.S: The report aims to evaluate and rank States / UTs based on the efficiency of their logistics and initiatives taken. S6 : LEADS 2021 framework evaluated States /UTs on 21 indicators, including 17 perceptions and four objectives-based indicators.

S1: Wind power is an inexhaustible source of clean energy.P: During the last decade, power production from the wind increased more than 25%.Q: Although the cost of electrical energy produced by the wind depends on favourable sites for the location of wind turbines, wind power is already cost competitive with power produced from fossil fuels.R: Much of the growth was in Europe, where most of the world's 17,000 megawatts of wind power is generated.S: One expert calls wind generation the fastest-growing electricity-producing technology in the world.S6: As examples, 13% of Denmark's power and more than 20% of power in the Netherlands, Spain and Germany is supplied by the wind.

S1: Education, it is believed, is inseparable from our societal aspirations.P: Education, as many would argue, was for realization of the Ultimate and the Absolute.Q: In ancient times, for example, there was a distinctive spiritual meaning associated with education.R: As these aspirations / world views undergo a process of transformation with the changing times, so does the meaning for education.S: It was to overcome the finiteness of existence: all earthly temptations and desires.S6 : But, for a modern / technical mind, this preoccupation with supreme spiritual knowledge may not hold such fascination.

S1: He resisted colonial education not just because it came from the West.P: Essentially, he disliked its inherent elitism, its irrelevance as far as the needs of India's rural masses were concerned.Q: For example, it was difficult for him to accept English as the medium of instruction, because he felt that it has created a permanent bar between the highly educated few and the uneducated many.R: Moreover, with his profound pedagogic sensitivity he could see the damaging effect of colonial education.S: He also felt that English made one a stranger in one's own land.S6: Besides, with this kind of education, one could not appreciate the dignity of manual labour.

S1: A corpus is an abundant source of samples of English usage.P: If this is to be of the meaning that has been previously explained, they cannot just be picked out of the corpus at random.Q: If they are to function as examples, however, then we need to ask just what it is they are intended to be examples of. R: Samples of the language, isolated from their natural context of use, will not normally exemplify word meanings, but will simply show one instance of the word's actual occurrence.S: This is because the context will usually make it unnecessary to spell the meaning out.S6: It is not only the previously explained meaning of the word that we might want a sample to exemplify, however, but also its collocational tendencies.

S1: Historians have often explained religious and social reform in India in the nineteenth century as a result of the Western impact upon the minds of men.P: With that purpose, we seek to analyze the thoughts and activities of individuals who were both religious reformers and vernacular publicists.Q: The equation of westernization and modernization has given way to a search for the indigenous sources of social changes.R: Recognizing the modernity of tradition is one thing however, whereas understanding the intellectual processes that produced indigenously generated change is another.S: Others have recognized that this was entirely too simple an explanation for the intellectual and social changes that took place in India and other places that fell under the foreign colonial rule.S6: Each of these vernacular-using reformers derived his arguments from within his own tradition.

S1 : The country has experienced unprecedented economic development since the adoption of the New Economic Policy in the year 1999.P: The middle classes have been the greatest beneficiary of the policy, who today enjoy far greater levels of income than their previous generations.Q : In the immediate aftermath of the newly announced policy, there was apprehension in the minds of the people.R: Within a few years, however, the beneficial impact of the newly announced policy became manifest through higher GDP and a thriving economy .S: Faced with a critical foreign exchange crisis, the country adopted the policy in the Union Budget presented in the year 1999.S6: If the country dreams of a much larger economy today, much of the optimism is due to the policy changes that took place in the year 1999.

S1: The Indian co-operative movement is probably one of the largest, strongest and the oldest in the world with widespread spatial coverage, diversified business activities and ample success stories.P: It has celebrated its Centenary very recently.Q: It is structured around the Rochdale Principles and Raiffeisen Model in wake of miseries of peasantry.R: It is termed as the “economic miracle” of the last century.S: Ever since the officially sponsored Act of 1904, the Movement has passed through a number of phases.S6: Co-operatives have been organized in areas like credit, marketing, distribution, dairy development, industry, sugar and so on.

S1 : Degenerative and man-made diseases, or rather, non-communicable diseases mark epidemiological transition in the contemporary world.P: Scholars reiterate that epidemiological transition and structural change in the disease pattern are inevitable.Q: This transition is the result of rapid increments in urbanization and industrialization.R: He argued that the disease pattern is shifting from the predominance of infectious and parasitic diseases to chronic and man-made diseases.S: Omran's epidemiological transition theory, 1971 portrayed a clear picture of the changing pattern of diseases prevalent all over the world.S6: This transition has led to the rise of living standards in general, whereby people enjoy a sedentary lifestyle with good socio-economic profile.
‘Alibi’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The accused was acquitted because he provided an alibi.

content.question_text: ‘Continuously’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The water was flowing from the leaking tap continuously.

content.question_text: 'Elicit'

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The demand for further information did not elicit an enthusiastic response.

content.question_text: ‘Climactic’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The climactic outcomes of restrained sustainability are positive.

content.question_text: ‘Affect’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The changed circumstances seemed to visibly affect her.

content.question_text: ‘Discrete’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The discrete series had many intervening gaps.

content.question_text: ‘It’s’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : It’s imperative that you study hard for success.

content.question_text: ‘Amidst’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Amidst all the confusion the thief managed to slink away unnoticed.

content.question_text: ‘Less’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : There is less sugar in the tea than what I asked for.

content.question_text: ‘Practise’

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : It is important to practise regularly to ensure good performance on match day.
